International businesses and organizations would face challenges in coordinating activities and communication with offices in regions where time moves at different speeds, leading to inefficient operations.
Telecommunication systems and infrastructure would need to be adapted to account for time differences, causing expenses for businesses and individuals.

Time-sensitive events and emergencies would be impacted, as they would be perceived and addressed differently between locations with different time speeds. This could lead to confusion and delayed response times in life-threatening situations.
The concept of time would become complex, and a new understanding of time and space would be needed to understand the implications of different time speeds.
The concept of aging and time of life would be affected differently in different regions, causing social and cultural changes over time.
